algorithm_technique: Calculate all possible horizontal and vertical distances and find common ones to form squares.
Optimize by storing smaller set of differences in a hash set for faster lookups.
problem_summary_simple: Find the largest square area by removing horizontal and vertical fences.
problem_summary_technical: Maximize side length of a square formed by two horizontal and two vertical fences, considering boundary fences.
key_insights: The problem boils down to finding the largest common difference between adjacent fences (including boundaries) in both horizontal and vertical directions.
Using a hash set to store differences from one set of fences allows for efficient lookup of common differences from the other set.
The modulo operation is important for the final result.
